H0.text: The automobiles are identical is the result of using interchangeable parts to manufacture automobiles.

H1.text: The automobiles wear out quickly as a result of using interchangeable parts to manufacture automobiles.

H2.text: The automobiles are difficult to design as a result of using interchangeable parts to manufacture them.

H3.text: The automobiles can be produced on an assembly line is the result of using interchangeable parts to manufacture automobiles.

A4.text: The concept of interchangeability was crucial to the introduction of the assembly line at the beginning of the 20th century

A5.text: Interchangeable parts are made to specifications that ensure they are so nearly identical that they will fit into any assembly of the same type

A6.text: The development of machine tools such as the screw-cutting lathe, metal planer, and milling machine, and of toolpath control via jigs and fixtures, provided the prerequisites for the modern assembly line by making interchangeable parts a practical reality.
